intro: Hieracium lugubre, commonly known as the melancholy hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow, with a distinctive dark center, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium lugubre is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
